intro: Eleocharis tenuissima, commonly known as slender spike-rush, is a small, grass-like plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, cylindrical stems and small, clustered spikes of flowers. This plant typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes, swamps, and the edges of ponds. Eleocharis tenuissima is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to tolerate waterlogged soils. Its simple morphology and ecological adaptability make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
